description: Dive into "Chasing Cascades: Mae Rim's Waterfall Wonders" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chasing Cascades: Mae Rim's Waterfall Wonders

places.generalDescription: Huai Kaeo Waterfall is a seasonal attraction located near Chiang Mai, offering smaller cascades and plenty of hiking trails. The area features picturesque natural scenery with easy access to the waterfall, although it may not be wheelchair or stroller accessible past a certain point. Visitors can enjoy the serene pools below the falls for picnicking and relaxation, as well as embark on an interesting jungle hike starting from the waterfall area.

sources.snippet: Huay Kaew Waterfall in Chiang Mai is the perfect spot for a scenic outdoor retreat, located just a few kilometers away from the city center. Leaving the hustle and bustle of downtown behind, you can reach this idyllic setting by either driving or taking a Grab taxi, with ample parking for cars and bikes as well as nearby food stalls and small shops.
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Waterfalls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Huay Kaew Waterfall is located in the same national park as Mae Sa Waterfall. It is a 10-meter high waterfall that can be reached by a short hike. The waterfall is surrounded by dense forest and is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Waterfall: A Guide to the Best Waterfalls in the Area

places.name: Huay Keaw Waterfall

reviews.text: A nice place to visit. We didn't see many tourist there. Most of the people are locals. The waterfall isn't really big but it's still worth visiting. It's easy to get to.

This Space is a must-visit for a peaceful nature escape. Open 8 am to 5 pm, it's immaculately clean, free to enter, and blissfully uncrowded. The abundance of butterflies and old trees is enchanting, and the seating near the waterfall offers a truly meditative experience. Highly recommended.

Huay Kaew Waterfall is a lovely little nature escape right at the edge of Chiang Mai city, located within Doi Suthep–Pui National Park. It's very easy to reach, just a short distance from the Chiang Mai Zoo and the Kruba Srivichai Monument, making it a convenient stop for both locals and travelers. The area is green, peaceful, and perfect for relaxing or enjoying a picnic. You can rent a mat, sit by the flowing water, and just enjoy the cool breeze from the forest.

Even though it's not the largest or most dramatic waterfall in Chiang Mai, it has its own charm. In the dry season, the water flow can be quite low, but during and after the rainy season (July–November) the stream becomes stronger and more refreshing. It's a popular spot for families, couples, and solo visitors who want a quick break from the city without having to hike far. There's also a short trail leading to Wang Bua Ban viewpoint for those who want a bit of adventure.

Overall, Huay Kaew Waterfall is not just a scenic natural spot-it's a peaceful retreat that's free to visit, easy to access, and well worth including in your Chiang Mai itinerary.

places.address: Suthep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the Doi Suithep-Pui National Park, Mae Sa Waterfall is a stunning 8-level cascade offering a refreshing plunge pool for swimming and well-maintained hiking trails. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely picnic amidst the natural beauty or explore nearby cultural attractions like the Chiang Mai City Arts and Cultural Center and the Hill-Tribe Research Institute Museum. The waterfall's 10 cascades each boast their own viewing deck, providing ample opportunities to relax and unwind.

sources.snippet: There are waterfalls abound in Northern Thailand and although Mae Sa is neither the biggest or most beautiful it is easily accessible from Chiang Mai and well worth a visit. Mae Sa Waterfall is in the Mae Sa area amongst a whole rake of interesting tourist attractions so if you are in the area then defiantly consider giving this waterfall a look. There are 10 tiers to this waterfall and there is a very well marked and mostly paved path which winds it was along the river and climbs up to the 10th tier.
sources.shortName: Mae Sa Waterfall – Barefoot Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall is located in Doi Suthep-Pui National Park, and most people visit the waterfall to escape the midday heat and admire the waterfall. The Mae Sa Waterfall is made up of smaller waterfalls, around 9 or 10, that aren’t too far apart from one another. You can hike to each waterfall, take a few photos or spend the day picnicking next to one of the waterfalls.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim: 10 Ways To Find Tranquility And Adventure

sources.snippet: Huay Kaew Waterfall in Chiang Mai is the perfect spot for a scenic outdoor retreat, located just a few kilometers away from the city center. Leaving the hustle and bustle of downtown behind, you can reach this idyllic setting by either driving or taking a Grab taxi, with ample parking for cars and bikes as well as nearby food stalls and small shops.
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Waterfalls in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall is an eight level waterfall set amidst the lush rainforests of Mae Sa. Visitors can picnic near the lower waterfalls, or trek upwards to the higher tiers which are uncrowded and peaceful. There are several vendors around who sell local street food delicacies that tourists can enjoy.
sources.shortName: Mae Sa Waterfall, Chiang Mai (2024) - Images, Timings

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall is located in the Doi Suthep-Pui National Park, about 30 kilometers from Chiang Mai. It is a seven-tier waterfall that cascades down a hill. The waterfall is surrounded by lush greenery, making it a perfect spot for a picnic.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Waterfall: A Guide to the Best Waterfalls in the Area

sources.snippet: A big waterfall is located at Doi Suthep-Pui National Park, Mae Rim District. Which has a total of 10 floors, each floor is far apart about 100-500 meters only. There are suitable for relaxing on your chilling day.
sources.shortName: 6 Best places to visit in Mae rim, Chiang Mai News & Activities - BOONSIRI HIGH SPEED CATAMARAN

sources.snippet: You will pass the Waterfall, Elephant Camps, the Botanical Garden, the riverside restaurants and other activities. Keep going for about 15km until you reach the Nong Hoi Rojal Project where you make a right turn.
sources.shortName: DAY TRIP FROM CHIANG MAI - Mon Cham & Mae Sa Waterfalls

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall l น้ำตกแม่สา This nature trail leads you to the beautiful Mae Sa Waterfall. It is relatively short and flat most of the way. It goes along the river stream until you reach the waterfall.
sources.shortName: Mae Sa Waterfall, Chiang Mai, Thailand - 18 Reviews, Map

sources.snippet: Mae Sa Waterfall (also known as Namtok Waterfall) is one of Thailand’s premier tourist attractions and is best known for its magnificent waterfalls amid the gorgeous natural landscape.
sources.shortName: Mae Sa Waterfall - Location & Getting there from Chiang Mai, Thailand

sources.snippet: One of the best waterfalls in Chiang Mai is located in Mae Rim, called Mae Sa waterfall. It is the largest and most picturesque waterfall in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Mae Rim and Its Natural Wonders
Tourist Attraction | Mae Rim Chaing Mai

places.name: Mae Sa Waterfall

reviews.text:
Entrance fee: 100 foreigner/20 local
Parking: 20 motorbike

Beautiful and amazing place to enjoy nature, there are 10 different areas to choose from. Water is refreshing not freezing cold, also pools aren't deep (you'll have to sit or get on your knees)

If you want to walk and get to know the whole place leave your vehicle in parking #1, if not go straight to parking #3 it's short walk to area #4

Starting from area #4 you'll find 3 beautiful small waterfalls in a row. It's worth it going all the way to area #10 (around 15 minute walk from area #4)

Toilets available in every parking lot #1 and #3. In parking lot #3 there are many places selling food.

Date 13/3/25

You need to buy ticket at the entrance. There was price for local and tourist but it was affordable. Signages and paths were well maintained. There were total of 10 waterfalls at the park and I had visited 9 out of 10. It was an easy trail which is suitable for family. You can spend few hours here hiking, picnic and playing water. But not during raining season. Just beware of slippery rocks. Good place to relax and chill.
Good for hiking and relaxing.weather is balance in the forest and food are normal price.you can play and feel under waterfall .it is have 10 step waterfalls and also wheelchair can go to step 5.

places.address: WV4X+H63, Soi Namtok Mae Sa 4, Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the midst of nature, Huai Tueng Thao Waterfall is a hidden gem waiting to be explored. The well-marked path, adorned with small signs and blue ribbons, adds an adventurous touch to the journey. Visitors can expect a 2km hike through the woods before reaching the enchanting waterfall. Despite warm temperatures, the area around the waterfall remains cool and refreshing.

sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Waterfall: A Guide to the Best Waterfalls in the Area

places.name: Huai Tueng Thao Waterfall

reviews.text: Well worth it! It's actually not as hard as I anticipated to navigate the path after reading the reviews. They must have updated the route since other reviews here. The path to the waterfall is marked with blue ribbons along the way. Though some are hard to see so keep your eyes out. Just look for the signage every time you get to a fork in the road and you can't go wrong. It's about 2km to the waterfalls. We spent 2 hours overall including time to go in the water and walk there and back. We had a grab drive us through the reservoir and then park at the waterfall checkpoint/ start of the hike and wait for us as others mentioned it was hard to get a ride back. We only saw a few others on the trail and had the waterfalls to ourselves when we got there. Take a walking stick from the starting point as it can be helpful during some of the terrain. Overall well worth it! Seems like a hidden gem with hardly any tourists!

A serendipitous stumble on my tour at Huey Theng Thao.

It took slightly more than 30mins to reach the waterfall, but it was well worth the hike. The route was not clearly demarcated, but
it helps that it is popular with the locals so I just had to follow them. There also were signs on the route to the waterfall, but do not expect too many of them. If in any doubt, follow the sound of water. You'd pass by several streams on the way.

Starting point will be at the Huey Theng Thao Checkpoint where you'd have to cross the concrete dam to the hiking path.
Worth every sweat! Fun hike, nice temperature and powerful waterfall. You can park at the entrance (be careful of the road gap when turning in). Entrance fee 20 for Thai and 50 for foreigners

places.address: VW6C+JX9, Don Kaeo, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand
